main event: Multiple UFO sightings were reported in Webb AFB, Texas in August 1952. The UFOs were observed by credible witnesses, including a trained pilot and an experienced weather officer.
interesting points: The UFO was described as oblong, white in color, and about the size of a C-47 airplane. It appeared to hover before rapidly accelerating and disappearing.
A pilot reported observing a disc-shaped object with a diameter of 50-60 feet traveling at a speed of over 500 knots, exhibiting maneuvers not known in present-day aircraft.
Radar tracking of the UFO was attempted but was unsuccessful, indicating advanced and unfamiliar characteristics of the object.
The UFO was visible for approximately 5 minutes before disappearing, and was compared in brightness to the landing light of an aircraft, but much brighter.
There were no indications of high-performance aircraft or evidence of sound or exhaust observed, raising questions about the propulsion system of the UFO.
witnesses: credible witnesses including an experienced weather officer and a trained pilot
